titles.title: To amend the Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988 to eliminate the discretion of the court in connection with the denial of certain Federal benefits upon conviction of certain drug offenses.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Amends the Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988 to remove discretion from the courts and thus make mandatory the denial of all Federal benefits for a fixed term after a conviction for distribution or possession of a controlled substance.
